content:
You're absolutely right! I'm open to spending a bit more for a high-quality handbag that fits my style and meets my needs. I'd say my personal style is a mix of classic and trendy. I like handbags that are timeless, yet still make a statement.

I think I'd be interested in exploring the brands you mentioned, especially Kate Spade New York and Longchamp. I've heard great things about their quality and style. I'm also intrigued by Côte&Ciel, I've seen some of their designs online and they seem really stylish and functional.

I'm not sure about Vera Bradley, I've seen their bags before but I'm not sure if they're really my style. And Zara is definitely an option, I've bought clothes from them before and I like their trendy designs.

Do you think it's worth investing in a high-quality handbag that might cost a bit more, or should I opt for a more affordable option that might not last as long?

Also, what are some key things I should look for when buying a handbag? I want to make sure I'm getting a good quality bag that will last a long time.
